intro: Aronicum latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf aronicum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive reddish hue on the underside. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Broadleaf aronicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
